Description: This tempalte contains all of the resources needed to create the base Synapse Bedrock Agent

agentName.Description: Provide a unique name for this bedrock agent.

ActionGroups.Description: Use the functions in this action group to help the user discover new Entities within Synapse.

Functions.Description: Use this function to help a user execute a search against Synapse by providing the function with a search term from the user. The results should be displayed in a table with the following columns.  The first column should be a row counter starting with 1 and incrementing by 1 for each row.  The second column should contain the id (the syn number) of the result.  The third column should contain the name of the result.  The fourth column should contain a short summary of the description when available. Note: Some of the descriptions might end with: --truncated-- indicating that the full description could not be returned. You can get the full (non-trucated) description using the 'get_description' function.
Functions.Name: org_sage_zero_search

term.Description: The search term from the user that will be used as the search input.

Functions.Description: Use this function to get the full description of any entity. This can be used for cases where a description has been marked as --truncated-- .
Functions.Name: org_sage_zero_get_description

synId.Description: The 'syn' Id of the entity to get the description for.

Functions.Description: Use this function to get metadata about any entity in Synapse.  This metadata includes user provided annotations, the user's permission information about the entity, and the entity's access control list (ACL).  If the entity is a table or view this will include information about its schema.  It will also include path information that defines where this entity resides in its hierarchy.
Functions.Name: org_sage_zero_get_entity_metadata

synId.Description: The 'syn' Id of the entity to get the metadata for.

Functions.Description: Use this function to discover the list of children that belong to a container entity such as a project or folder.
Functions.Name: org_sage_zero_get_entity_children

synId.Description: The 'syn' Id of the entity to get the children for.

Functions.Description:
Use this function to get the current session access level that is used when exploring data in synapse on behalf of the user.
There are three possible access levels: <access_level><name>public</name><value>PUBLICLY_ACCESSIBLE</value></access_level>, <access_level><name>private</name><value>READ_YOUR_PRIVATE_DATA</value></access_level> and <access_level><name>write</name><value>WRITE_YOUR_PRIVATE_DATA</value></access_level>.
When the session access level is public, the user will only see data that is publicily accessible. When the session access level is private the user will see data that they have access to, including private data. When the access level is write, the user will be able to create or modify data. 
You should suggest the user to change their access level when appropriate.
For example, if the current access level is public and there are not many relevant results, you might suggest the user to change their access level to private.
For an operation that can create or modify data the user must have the access level set to write. Only the user can change their access level, you cannot do it on their behalf.
Functions.Name: org_sage_zero_get_session_access_level
